name: Renaissance Arlington Capital View Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great stay in Crystal City. New, Clean, Modern.....no bad things to say about the place. Shuttle van to and from the airport (DCA) as well as the nearest Metro station (Crystal City Station). I would highly recommend this hotel for those looking to do business in the area or even staying just outside the DC area and looking to do the tourist thing. I would even say this is a great place for a romantic stay as well as the rooms are very nice and modern.
reviews.title: New, Clean, Modern hotel in Crystal City close to Regan National Airport

reviews.text: Several eateries nearby either in Crystal City walking distance... or 2 Metro stations away on King Street. Bottom line.. if you are going to stay close to the airport and are looking into this area... Stay here, you will not be disappointed.
reviews.title: Beautiful place, poorly managed

reviews.text: Nice work out area as well.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, average service

reviews.text: The place and installations are very nice and modern and tastefully decorated, however the devil is in the details...
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Got a hair in my wifes food. We didn't complain just pointed it out. They didn't do much about it. Not even offered to take it off the bill. The hair was baked into the pizza crust so it is not like it fell on top of it afterward.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel, Poor Customer Service

reviews.text: Easily accessible to DC and conveniently located near Ronald Reagan airport in Crystal City, the hotel has a sleek, modern feel. The lobby has a variety of newspapers available and computers to access boarding passes. The lobby bar is nice - prosecco, yum! The building is LEED gold certified - leaving one feeling virtuous for staying at an environmentally friendly location. Nonetheless, nothing felt as if it was skimping on energy - for example, even though many hotels have taken away in-room refrigerators, this hotel still has them. Bathrooms come equipped with only a shower -- no tub -- but all the better for the glass doors (no swaying shower curtains) and large size. Comfortable beds with all-white duvets and lots of pillows. Large windows in the rooms to allow ambient light to dominate.
reviews.title: New, modern & environmentally friendly!

reviews.text: The outdoor, rooftop seating (second floor?) was great. After an evening gala, my group retired to some of the outdoor seating and enjoyed a comfortable chat under the stars. The indoor pool is heated and smallish.
reviews.title: First stay here

reviews.text: Brought the family, 4 of us. Room wasn't available when we showed after 2pm. Bell hop stated our luggage would be placed in our room while we toured the area. Upon return (8pm) we checked in giving the Bell our ticket #. Luggage was not together and not in the room. Took many attempts to locate our belongings as they were removed from the luggage cart they were put upon. Requested & received 2 beds, only two bath towels were in the room, had to request more for four people. Would have to rethink about staying again with the family.
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.text: Great hotel especially if getting on a deal and breakfast and internet is included! Clean, retro, post-modern - new hotel feel with a great lobby and a super, complimentary breakfast in the ground level restaurant/bar. The omelets were superb and the staff extremely friendly and hospitable. Children friendly .. where the pool was quite crowded .. but it was the Easter weekend. Comfortable proximity to DC downtown.
reviews.title: Modern, Quiet, Elegant

reviews.text: I flew into Reagan National, was picked up by the Marriott van service and within minutes was at the door of the Renaissance. The staff was freindly and professional. My room on the 15th floor was quiet. No airport of city noise. The bruch had a nice variety of foods and the service was attentive. The main lobby is a work of art. Modern wood scuplture and large lights make the hotel go beyond a "W" Hotel expereince. The location was great since you were within a short distanct to the heart of Washington DC without the hub-bud of staying in a city known for gridlock. There is a Metro Station near by on the Blue Line to move about Metro and Central DC.
reviews.title: Great deal & COOKIES!!!!

reviews.text: I stayed here for one night as I had meetings in Virginia. The hotel is very new with a bright and airy feel and very contemporary decor. The folks I encountered at the front desk were very friendly and helpful. A staff member was assisting another guest with check in and almost immediately another staff person appeared to assist me. Check in was extremely fast and efficient. I arrived at the hotel around 5:00pm and was surprised to see housekeeping still cleaning rooms when I went to my room. In fact, right after I went into my room there was a tap at the door and then someone from housekeeping was opening the door. Upon seeing me, she apologized and said she didn't realize the room had already been cleaned. The hotel is a few blocks from the stores and restaurants of Crystal City. In nice weather it would probably be a nice little walk. The hotel does provide shuttle service to the Crystal City Metro stop and they also provide shuttle service to Reagan National Airport. I took the airport shuttle service both ways and while I appreciate the convenience, it did run rather slow. The airport shuttle service also stops at several other nearby Marriott Properties, including a Residence Inn which is apparently connected to the Renaissance. The hotel has one of the best fitness centers I've seen at any hotel. In addition to a number of treadmills and eliptical machines, there were other machines (including leg press, leg curl, leg extension, lat machine, smith machine), several benches, bosu balls and numerous free weights to let you get a gym quality work out. My only complaint about my stay was that there were no washclothes in the bathroom in my room, which I only discovered as I was about to step into the shower. What I thought was a stack of wash clothes turned out to be a stack of hand towels so I had to improvise. Despite the very minor annoyances with the shuttle and the bath linens, all in all I enjoyed my stay and would definately stay here again.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

reviews.text: I came for a conference. The room was lovely, and the bed was absolutely amazing (I'm ordering some of the pillows from their website!). There was a refrigerator in the room, which is a rarity in higher-end hotels. I heard very little noise from outside the hotel, or from the hallway, but the walls between the rooms seem to be thin. When I was in the bathroom at the same time as my neighbor, I could hear EVERYTHING. Otherwise, though, the rooms were very well thought-out: lots of plugs near the bed, an alarm clock/ipod dock, a very good restaurant with fairly reasonable prices, and very nice meeting spaces. It was a comfortable place for a meeting, and had all the conveniences and amenities to make my stay pleasant.
reviews.title: Lovely, comfortable room

reviews.text: The shuttle from the airport was wonderful! But the lobby is very loud and modern decor is really not inviting or comfortable. When I arrived after 4 pm, my king sized bed was not available (not yet cleaned?) but I was offered 2 double beds on a very quiet floor. Went back to the loud, uncomfortable lobby to use the free internet service, but there are no plugs if you want to use your own laptop. I couldn't get their airline ticket to print out my return boarding pass. My room did not get cleaned. There was a coffee maker in the room, but only one cup of caffeinated coffee for a room with 2 double beds. And the people in the room next to mine were so loud I had to call security - at 3 am. Breakfast - granola with yogurt - was a tiny bit of yogurt with way too much granola, sprinkled with a few berries. And for something that didn't require preparation, I waited far too long. Suffice it to say, this was not a great Renaissance experience. Until I got back on the shuttle to the airport. The driver was extremely kind and gracious, and put a smile back on my face!
reviews.title: Nicest thing about hotel was the airport shuttle service!

reviews.text: Stayed here while attending an AMA seminar, great hotel. Super updated, I had no issues with check in, walked right in to the stand, had everything all ready including the cards. The room was nicely updated, nice bed. I love the walk in showers, it was as spacious as the one at home. One thing was, I couldn't get the room to get THAT cold, who knows if that was user error though. Nice added point, the alarm clocks are the iphone docks and you can change the brightness, it's the little things :) . Overall great location, I never had an issue with outside sound. If you want a clean, very well updated place to stay while on business, it's a great choice.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.text: From the time I arrived no one greeted me at the door, there was no one working at the bell stand, and when i saw someone as i waited by the bell stand he signaled me to come toward him. I did not, I told him to come to me so I can check my bags so i could go to the bar. Went to the bar, and the guy even after seeing my ID was looking at me as though I am not good enough for his bar. I am 30 years old, and well dressed and a rewards member. Once I left the bar to proceed to the front desk, the agent did not acknowledge my Rewards status or confirm any of my special request until I said something. Went up to the room and waited and waited and waited for the bags and finally almost tired of waiting I finally called DTS and I said to her, "Im ****** **************, I don't know my room number, but i need my bags." I was calling from the hotel room phone. I asked here do you know who this is? She said, "yes, now what can I do for you?" Thins was said very rudely and never even attempted to call me by name or anything. So, 1 hour later bags finally arrive, not even an apology and the guy actually waited a few seconds as though I should tip him. We showered and came to the bar area again, me and my friend went to the host stand and no one there. Finally once seated We ordered a mojito, and 15 minutes later came back to say they are out. Come on, give us options! I told the server, me and my friend are going somewhere else. he responded, "oh, ok." and walked away. RUDE! Keeps going, I would rather stay at an average older hotel with warm staff than a beautiful hotel with people working in it acting like they don't care about their jobs or their customers.
reviews.title: Poor training, staff could be friendlier...

reviews.text: Stayed here last night. It comes across as clean, crisp and efficient. Breakfast was wonderful. It seems it would appeal to young professionals although we saw mostly familiies this weekend.
reviews.title: Nice..just nice

reviews.text: This hotel is amazing. Really. But not five stars. It's not a five-star hotel. There are certainly parts of it that are five stars, but there are also parts of it that really could be one star.
reviews.title: Standing in the shoulders of five-star giants

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, the rooms were clean. Period blood on one sheet, not a big deal. Hallways are a bit small but nice. Public areas are HUGE, there are terraces on 2nd and 3rd floors that wrap around the hotel. There's no view unless you enjoy watching the employee exit at the Hyatt. Pool is puny, fitness area is small but not used. Internet is ludicrous, but free in lobby and Socci and also free if there is a conference going on there, which is whenever. The iMacs in the lobby are free sometimes, othertimes there are five year olds going on Club Penguin.
reviews.title: Sooo Dissapointed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service is one star. There is no concierge, and front desk is unhelpful. It's almost easier to raid the unlocked supply closets rather than ask for towels and wait until the next morning when the housekeeping staff is on duty. Parking is pricey but fine. Crystal city is nice.
reviews.title: Great D.C. Area hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, great hotel. Service sucks. But yea, it isn't a five star hotel and your expecations shouldn't be too high.
reviews.title: Newest, Nicest Marriott in Crystal City

description: Discover the center of convenience and luxury at the Renaissance Arlington Capital View Hotel and rethink what you know about staying in Northern Virginia. Carving a modern outline in the Crystal City skyline, our hotel is designed to be LEED-certified and boasts award-winning architecture inspired by motion and enhanced by light and texture, which allows us to create an organic and dynamic experience for all of our guests.We are located just minutes from the landmarks, corporate offices and government agencies of the capital area. Reagan National Airport is less than 1 mile away and we offer free shuttle service to and from the airport and closest Metro stop. Travelers can also tour the neighborhood with our in-house bicycles available to guests at no cost.SOCCi Kitchen + Bar serves a handcrafted Italian menu and hosts live entertainment acts each week. Espressamente illy Cafe is right in our lobby as well for cappuccinos and take-away meals.
